marketNews.title: ðŸ“ˆ NCKL 9M24: Net Profit +8.4% YoY, Exceeding Expectations
marketNews.content: Trimegah Bangun Persada ($NCKL) recorded the highest quarterly net profit since its IPO in 3Q24, realizing 2 trillion rupiah (+12.6% QoQ, +18.2% YoY). This result brings the net profit for 9M24 to 4.8 trillion rupiah (+8.4% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equals 93%/91% of Stockbit/consensus estimates for FY24. Operationally, revenue in 3Q24 grew +11.9% QoQ and cost of revenue rose more moderately (+3.7% QoQ), causing the gross profit margin to increase to 37.5% (vs. 2Q24: 32.6%). Furthermore, operational expenses decreased by -7.3% QoQ, pushing operating profit growth higher (+35.5% QoQ). Quarter-over-quarter, NCKL's margin improvement was driven by: 1) higher limonite sales alongside the commencement of operations at the HPAL smelter owned by the company's subsidiary; and 2) an increase in ferronickel (FeNi) selling prices. Volume of Limonite Ore Sales Increased Along with the Operation of the Subsidiary's HPAL Smelter. The increase in limonite ore sales volume (+69.3% QoQ, +103.2% YoY) in 3Q24 was driven by the start of operations of the HPAL smelter owned by the company's subsidiary, PT Obi Nickel Cobalt, in August 2024. This sale is not eliminated because NCKL's ownership in PT Obi Nickel Cobalt is only 10%. FeNi Production Volume Stable with Margin Increasing QoQ. The production volume of FeNi nickel was relatively stable (-1.8% QoQ, +3.0% YoY) in 3Q24, with a sales volume increase (+2.5% QoQ, +3.6% YoY). The FeNi selling price was recorded at 11,921 US dollars per ton (+4.8% QoQ, -7.7% YoY), with a cash cost of 8,353 US dollars per ton (+3.7% QoQ, -9.8% YoY). NCKL Starts Electrolytic Cobalt Production Due to Higher Margin. In the earnings call today, Friday (22/11), NCKL management announced that the company has started producing electrolytic cobaltâ€”a derivative product of mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP)â€”with a capacity of 6,000 tons per year, and exports began in August 2024. This product has a higher selling price, namely 22,047 US dollars per ton (vs. cobalt sulfate: 17,031 US dollars per ton) with a lower cash cost (8,308 US dollars per ton vs. cobalt sulfate: 9,020 US dollars per ton) as of 9M24. Electrolytic cobalt also has the same conversion ratio as the conversion ratio of MHP to cobalt sulfate. Key Takeaway. NCKL management stated in today's earnings call that the company expects 4Q24 operational performance to be relatively stable compared to 3Q24. Therefore, we assess that the performance estimates for NCKL in FY24 and FY25 need to be revised upwards. In today's trading, NCKL's stock price strengthened +3.09% to 835 rupiah per share. Based on existing performance estimates, NCKL is currently trading at a valuation of 8.02x P/E (1-Year Forward), below the historical average of 8.4x.

marketNews.title: BP and Partners to Invest USD 8.5 Billion in Carbon Capture and Ubadari Gas Field Development in West Papua
marketNews.content: Oil and gas producer BP and its partners will invest 8.5 billion US dollars in the carbon capture project and the development of the Ubadari gas field in West Papua. BP CEO, Murray Auchincloss, said that the development of the gas field can generate an additional gas resource of about 3 trillion cubic feet. Gas production from the field can commence in 2028.

marketNews.title: Japanese Government to Approve Stimulus Package Worth 21.9 Trillion Yen or USD 140 Billion on Friday (22/11)
marketNews.content: The Japanese government signed an economic stimulus package worth 21.9 trillion yen or 140 billion US dollars on Friday (22/11) to support consumer purchasing power amidst the coalition party's worst election result in 15 years. The package includes aid of approximately 30,000 yen for low-income households, fuel and energy subsidies, and assistance for small businesses. The overall business impact of these incentives is estimated to reach 39 trillion yen. The Japanese government stated that these incentives are aimed at ensuring a transition to a growth-oriented economy, driven by wage increases and investment.

marketNews.title: International Criminal Court (ICC) Judges Issue Arrest Warrants for Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu, Former Defense Minister Yoav Gallant, and Hamas Commander Mohammed Deif
marketNews.content: Judges at the International Criminal Court (ICC) released arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, and former Israeli Defense Minister, Yoav Gallant. The ICC also issued an arrest warrant for Hamas commander, Mohammed Deif, although Israel stated that Deif had been killed in an airstrike in Gaza in July 2024. The ICC judges stated that the three individuals are suspected of committing war crimes in the Israel-Palestine conflict.

marketNews.title: Inspector General Setyo Budiyanto Officially Elected as KPK Chairman for the 2024-2029 Period
marketNews.content: Inspector General Setyo Budiyanto was officially elected on Thursday (21/11) as the Chairman of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) for the 2024-2029 period. Setyo is an active 3-star police general, with his last assignment being Inspector General at the Ministry of Agriculture. Responding to this, the non-governmental organization in the anti-corruption sector, Transparency International Indonesia, encouraged Setyo to step down from the police force to avoid conflicts of interest.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia reports Broad Money (M2) increased by +6.7% YoY to IDR 9,078.6 Trillion in October 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that economic liquidity or broad money (M2) in October 2024 grew by +6.7% YoY to 9,078.6 trillion rupiah (vs. September 2024: 7.2% YoY). This development was driven by the growth of narrow money (M1) by +7.1% YoY and quasi money by +4.2% YoY. The development of M2 in October 2024 was mainly influenced by the contraction of net claims on the central government by -0.1% YoY (vs. September 2024: +12.3% YoY), while credit disbursement remained stable at +10.4% YoY. Net foreign assets in October 2024 grew by +1.6% YoY (vs. September 2024: -0.3% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PACK: Changes Business Activities, Plans Rights Issue, and Targets Revenue of IDR 5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: PACK: Digital Packaging Solutions announced it will change its company name to Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama, and change its business activities to a holding company activity in the nickel trading sector. PACK predicts that this change in business activity will increase sales to around 5.3 trillion rupiah in 2025, with a net profit of around 346 billion rupiah. PACK also plans to hold a rights issue of up to 100 billion new shares, with the exercise price to be announced later, where the proceeds from the funds are intended for capital expenditure and working capital. These corporate action plans will be discussed in the EGM (RUPSLB) on December 30, 2024.

tickerNews.title: BBYB rumors: Akulaku group reportedly offered divestment to Prajogo Pangestu, which was denied by BRPT CEO
tickerNews.content: _Kontan_ reported that the Akulaku group through PT Akulaku Silvrr Indonesia and/or Rockcore Financial Technology Co. Ltd. attempted to offer a divestment of a portion of Bank Neo Commerce shares to the founder of the Barito group, Prajogo Pangestu. However, Prajogo's son and President Director of Barito Pacific ($BRPT), Agus Salim Pangestu, told _Kontan_ that the news was untrue. This rumor emerged amidst the divestment plan by the Akulaku group to reduce its ownership in BBYB from 39.95% to a maximum of 30%, which was approved in the EGM (RUPSLB) on November 15, 2024.

tickerNews.title: SMRA: Marketing sales reached ~IDR 3.2 Trillion in 10M24, only 64% of the 2024 target
tickerNews.content: Summarecon Agung ($SMRA) recorded marketing sales of 515.3 billion rupiah (+69% MoM, +93% YoY) in October 2024. This result brought marketing sales for 10M24 to ~3.2 trillion rupiah (-5% YoY), fulfilling only 64% of the 2024 target of 5 trillion rupiah. The housing segment contributed 74% of the 10M24 marketing sales, followed by shophouses (14%), apartments (6%), land plots (5%), and office/commercial (1%). Specifically, housing marketing sales in October 2024 reached 435.9 billion rupiah, marking the highest level throughout 2024.

tickerNews.title: FILM: Tencent unit sold 251.6 million shares in November 2024, reducing stake to 11.51%
tickerNews.content: MD Entertainment shareholders, Image Frame Investment (HK) Limited ("Tencent"), sold 251.6 million $FILM shares at an average price of 1,200 rupiah per share on November 12, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 302 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, the ownership of Image Frame Investment (HK) Limited ("Tencent") in FILM decreased from 14.05% to 11.51%.

tickerNews.title: MINA: Hapsoro buys ~243.8 million shares, becoming the new controller and planning a mandatory tender offer
tickerNews.content: Sanurhasta Mitra shareholders, Hapsoro, purchased approximately 243.8 million $MINA shares at an average price of 23 rupiah per share on November 20, 2024. The total transaction value reached 5.6 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Hapsoro will become the new controller in MINA with a direct ownership of 5.73% and indirect ownership through PT Basis Utama Prima of 45.71%. Consequently, Hapsoro will conduct a mandatory tender offer for the remaining MINA shares.

tickerNews.title: BMRI: Bank Mandiri Director Agus Dwi Handaya increased ownership to 0.0119% after buying 472,500 shares
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri Director, Agus Dwi Handaya, purchased 472,500 $BMRI shares at an average price of 6,350 rupiah per share on November 15, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 3 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Agus Dwi Handaya's ownership in BMRI increased from 0.0114% to 0.0119%.

tickerNews.title: TSPC to distribute interim dividend for FY2024 amounting to IDR 112.7 Billion (IDR 25 per share)
tickerNews.content: Tempo Scan Pacific ($TSPC) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 112.7 billion rupiah or 25 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is December 2, 2024, with payment on December 19, 2024. Referring to the TSPC stock price at the close of trading on Friday (22/11) at 2,570 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 1%.

tickerNews.title: IMAS: PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa sold 55 million shares as a reverse repo, stake drops to 8.72%
tickerNews.content: Indomobil Sukses Internasional shareholder, PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa, sold 55 million $IMAS shares at an average price of 652 rupiah per share on November 8, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 35.9 billion rupiah and was intended as a reverse repo. Following this transaction, the ownership of PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa in IMAS decreased from 10.10% to 8.72%.

tickerNews.title: META: Controller requests extension for voluntary tender offer as 6,110 shareholders have not yet participated
tickerNews.content: Nusantara Infrastructure ($META) President Director, M. Ramdani Basri, stated that the company's controller, PT Metro Pacific Tollways Indonesia Services, has again requested an extension of the voluntary tender offer period from the OJK. This step was taken because there were still 6,110 META shareholders who had not participated in the voluntary tender offer as of September 30, 2024. Previously, META had held 2 rounds of voluntary tender offers as part of its go private plan.

tickerNews.title: DRMA: Commissioner Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara increased ownership to 1.4% after buying 500,000 shares
tickerNews.content: Dharma Polimetal ($DRMA) Commissioner, Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara, purchased 500,000 DRMA shares at an average price of 1,065 rupiah per share on November 19, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 532 million rupiah. Following this transaction, Noel's ownership in DRMA increased from 1.38% to 1.4%.
